intro: Gordonia marginata, commonly known as the white-barked evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa and Namibia. The plant is characterized by its smooth, white bark and dense, evergreen foliage. It produces small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. Gordonia marginata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained, acidic soils.
